item.title: Some Black Ops 7 Multiplayer Playlists Will Have SBMM, But Most Won't
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Ahead of Call of Duty: Black Ops 7's release on November 14, Activision has confirmed a key detail about the multiplayer mode. Some playlists will indeed have skill-based matchmaking toggled on, but most won't.

Developer Treyarch said on social media that the majority of the Black Ops 7 multiplayer playlists will have what is described as "open" matchmaking. In these playlists, skill is only "minimally considered," just as it was during the Black Ops 7 beta where Activision first rolled this out.

The exception for Black Ops 7 will be one rotating Moshpit playlist where "skill will be an important consideration." Additionally, Black Ops 7 Ranked play will feature SBMM when it launches in Season 2.

Treyarch also clarified that Black Ops 7 will feature persistent lobbies, which is what fans had asked for.

Hey everyone, to clarify: just like in the Black Ops 7 Beta, skill will be minimally considered in every Open playlist. We've also added persistent lobbies and new playlists since the Beta, including Quick Play.

Here's what you'll see on day one: pic.twitter.com/cEddWYzpAn

— Treyarch (@Treyarch) November 12, 2025

In October, Activision announced that Black Ops 7 multiplayer would be non-SBMM by default. Given that, some saw this recent announcement as Activision backpedaling on its original promise. But Activision never said Black Ops 7 would not have any SBMM playlists, only that non-SBMM will be the default for Black Ops 7 at launch.

For years, Call of Duty fans had asked Activision to deprioritize SBMM, and it's conspicuous that it's finally coming in a year when Battlefield 6 has a lot of momentum. Activision has not explained specifically why it's adding non-SBMM playlists to Black Ops 7.

In addition to standard multiplayer, Black Ops 7 will launch with a 20v20 mode called Skirmish in which players can fly with wingsuits and drive vehicles to traverse larger maps. There is a campaign mode, too, featuring an open-world Endgame element on the Avalon map, along with the return of Zombies.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Elden Ring Nightreign: The Forsaken Hollows DLC Announced And Coming Sooner Than We Thought
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Remember when we thought Elden Ring Nightreign's DLC would launch by the end of March 2026? Well, developer From Software said that's way too long and announced that the roguelike/souls-like's next add-on content, The Forsaken Hollows, hits consoles and PC on December 4. Happy holidays, you Nightfarers.

The Japanese developer made the announcement during PlayStation's State of Play livestream on November 11. The trailer, which made its way onto publisher Bandai Namco's official X account, isn't that long. But it does reveal two new playable characters, a new Shifting Earth event, and some new enemies.

In our war against the Night, every battle left a scar.
These wounds were given will. A foul life, born of cast-away souls.
Steel your resolve, Nightfarers. This hunt must be seen to its end.#ELDENRING #NIGHTREIGN The Forsaken Hollows launches on December 4, 2025. pic.twitter.com/q7WB94urfh

— Bandai Namco US (@BandaiNamcoUS) November 11, 2025

Following its reveal, From Software marketing representative Miku Watanabe took to the PlayStation Blog to break down The Forsaken Hollows a bit more.

The two incoming Nightfarers are the book-wielding Scholar who "gains incredible advantages through battlefield observation" and the hooded Undertaker who "sends enemies to the afterlife with ruthless efficiency." Watanabe didn't detail the new enemies, instead merely teasing that they're "tormenting Limveld." Meanwhile, the new Shifting Earth event, The Great Hollow, will produce a "great cavity in the depths of Limveld" that features exotic ruins and temples, sacred towers, and crystals emitting life-draining miasma. Yikes.

The Forsaken Hollows will cost $15 by itself if you already own Elden Ring Nightreign. However, if you own the $55 Deluxe Edition or the $200 Collector's Edition of the the game, then you get access to The Forsaken Hollows as soon as it launches. Be wary, though: Watanabe noted that the Deluxe Upgrade Pack will be renamed to The Forsaken Hollows DLC on November 12, warning of potential duplicate purchases.

From Software's parent company, Kadokawa, had revealed in a recent earnings report that Elden Ring's Nightreign DLC was "planned for release in FY2025." Since both companies are Japanese, and fiscal years are slightly different in Japan, the initial thought was that the the game's add-on content would be released by the end of March 2026. Well, we stand corrected.

Elden Ring Nightreign is available now on PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, and Xbox Series X|S. Once again, the game's DLC, The Forsaken Hollows, will arrive on December 4--just in time for Christmas.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/elden-ring-nightreign-the-forsaken-hollows-dlc-announced-and-coming-sooner-than-we-thought/1100-6536137/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: PS6 And Next Xbox May Not Release Until 2028 Due To GTA 6 Delay, Expert Says
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

It is understood that Sony and Microsoft are working on new console platforms--the PS6 and next Xbox--but when might they be released? According to Piers Harding-Rolls, the research director for games at Ampere Analysis, these new consoles could launch later than expected due to the GTA 6 delay. This could happen, but it's not what Ampere expects.

He told GI.biz that the delay of GTA 6 will have a "significant impact on console sales dynamics in 2026." This is because, with GTA 6 now coming in November 2026 instead of May 2026, console sales will be "even more back-loaded" than normal. How does the GTA 6 delay impact the next-generation console release dates? Harding-Rolls said his company is modeling the new systems to launch in late 2027, but that could change if the platform-holders want to squeeze more juice out of GTA 6.

"Might the console companies be tempted to get more from the current console generation by riding the GTA 6 wave and waiting until 2028? The fact that games are now cross-gen makes this less of a factor, perhaps, but such is the size of the GTA franchise, the launch timing will get all areas of the games business thinking about their product strategies," he explained.

Harding-Rolls went on to say that GTA 6 is going to be "such an important driver of hardware sales," and not just when the game comes out, but for multiple years to follow. "Sony and Microsoft will have wanted a much earlier release than late 2026 so they could generate momentum earlier in the cycle," he said.

One of the reasons that GTA 5 sold so well was because the game launched later in the PS3 and Xbox 360 lifecycles, coming multiple years after those consoles arrived. This meant that the install base of those machines was big at the time, and then Rockstar re-released GTA 5 for PS4 and Xbox One when those consoles came out in 2014. Then Rockstar put the game on PC in 2015 and then brought it to PS5 and Xbox Series X|S in 2022.

What do we know about the PS6 and next Xbox?

Both Sony and Microsoft have confirmed that they are working on new consoles, but neither has been officially announced. Sony, for its part, recently showed off some new experimental technology that could power its next console. Microsoft, meanwhile, announced a partnership with AMD earlier this year for future platforms. Rumors have swirled recently that Microsoft could quit the console business, but the company says that's not true.

For now, GTA 6 is confirmed only for PS5 and Xbox Series X|S, but if Rockstar follows a similar playbook to GTA 5, fans can expect it to come to PC later and possibly new consoles.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/ps6-and-next-xbox-may-not-release-until-2028-due-to-gta-6-delay-expert-says/1100-6536134/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: KFC And Monster Hunter Wilds Join Forces For Finger-Lickin' In-Game Loot
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Capcom has announced a new collaboration with KFC in Japan, themed around Monster Hunter Wilds. Starting on November 19, KFC branches will sell two limited-edition meals with unique packaging and codes for in-game items redeemable in Monster Hunter Wilds.

The packaging shows off art of a Felyne partner that accompanies players in Monster Hunter Wilds (via VGC), with the little critter cosplaying as KFC icon Colonel Sanders--complete with a trendy outfit and facial hair. The Feast Set comes with codes for a Luxury Ingredient Set of campfire cooking ingredients and the KFC Colonel Sanders Felyne charm, while the Spice Up Set includes a Hunting Item Set of consumable items and a KFC Barrel Felyne Charm. Upgrading a meal from standard to large will also get a themed sticker set.

Four KFC stores will also be decorated to make customers feel like they've entered the world of Monster Hunter, and the promotion will conclude on December 16. This isn't the first time that KFC has partnered up with a well-known video game, as back in 2021, there was a crossover with Genshin Impact in China. That collaboration was unfortunately cut short over COVID-19 protocol violations.

Capcom has also teamed up with McDonald's Japan last month to release a line of Street Fighter-themed burgers alongside free ketchup-and-mustard-inspired costumes for the game's roster.

Meanwhile, Monster Hunter Wilds sales have continued to decline since launch, with Capcom reporting that it only sold 160,000 units of the game over its last financial quarter that ended on September 30, 2025. This is a major dip from the previous quarter that saw 477,000 sales of Monster Hunter Wilds, and Capcom president Haruhiro Tsujimoto suggested that the high price of the PS5--the "main platform" for Monster Hunter Wilds players in Japan--was hurting sales of the game in that region.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/kfc-and-monster-hunter-wilds-join-forces-for-finger-lickin-in-game-loot/1100-6536135/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f
